alert.note: Alert for Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 12:00AM CDT until July 09 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In the Oklahoma Panhandle, Texas County and far western Beaver County. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1159 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Guymon, Hooker, Goodwell, Optima, Hardesty, Hough, Adams, Baker, Eva and Turpin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
